description: Number of ways of dissecting a polygon into n heptagons.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: F. Harary, E. M. Palmer and R. C. Read, On the cell-growth problem for arbitrary polygons, Discr. Math. 11 (1975), 371-389.
formula: See Mathematica code.a(n) ~ 2^(6*n - 1) * 3^(6*n + 1/2) / (sqrt(Pi) * n^(5/2) * 5^(5*n + 5/2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 13 2016
mathematica: p=7; Table[(Binomial[(p-1)n, n]/(((p-2)n+1)((p-2)n+2)) + If[OddQ[n], If[OddQ[p], Binomial[(p-1)n/2, (n-1)/2]/n, (p+1)Binomial[((p-1)n-1)/2, (n-1)/2]/((p-2)n+2)], 3Binomial[(p-1)n/2, n/2]/((p-2)n+2)]+Plus @@ Map[EulerPhi[ # ]Binomial[((p-1)n+1)/#, (n-1)/# ]/((p-1)n+1)&, Complement[Divisors[GCD[p, n-1]], {1, 2}]])/2, {n, 1, 20}] (* _Robert A. Russell_, Dec 11 2004 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from _Robert A. Russell_, Dec 11 2004
